title: Probably the best game/team I've ever had, what's yours?

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body: So i had a match about an hour ago, where from the lobby the entire team clicked, one of those lobbies where everybody calls and we all want different spots, in-game we synchronized so easily it was like we'd been playing ranked 5s for a year together, so it got me thinking, what's the best game you've ever had, and can you link us :)?

replies.body: It's when it's 1hr in and you're playing Vayne.

Not the most fun/non toxic game as such, but it was a wow moment 
we had an actual red team vs blue team battle in aram :P
dude that totally counts... as long as somebody got crushed by a tank!
stfu with your "perfect games" the only reason they were so "perfect" is because every lane got outmatched/made to many errors
this wasnt a brag post, just a positive post showing how sometimes teams work well together, my apologies if i offended you.

lol yeah, I just randomly felt like being toxic idk why, but really having these perfect games you don't learn anything from them, the harder the games the more you learn, provided you don't rage and reflect on all your mistakes.

Being behind by this much in a ranked promotion game I think it was. I played badly but I insisted on not surrendering and just trying and in the end got a 5 man ulti and we won.

EDIT: Was playing Leona by the way, I don't have the link to that game sadly, as it was a while ago.

From the start, nobody argued with lanes, the atmosphere was so positive, and we steamrolled the opponent, until the support's kill-streak reached legendary.

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/67355609/200801540?tab=overview

(Plus, the game ended before 20 minutes, so that means that we destroyed the nexus before they even surrendered!)
